title: Who is Priscila Barbosa, the queen of rideshare mafia
Why Barcelona protesters are squirting water at tourists
content: Protestors in Barcelona use water pistols to highlight overcrowding, rental hikes, environmental issues, and neighborhood identity loss due to tourism. This gained media attention, including from Time. Authorities pledged sustainable tourism measures. Their playful shooting underscores local concerns, aiming to balance tourism and quality of life in this popular destination.
summary: Protestors in Barcelona use water pistols to highlight overcrowding, rental hikes, environmental issues, and neighborhood identity loss due to tourism. This gained media attention, including from Time. Authorities pledged sustainable tourism measures. Their playful shooting underscores local concerns, aiming to balance tourism and quality of life in this popular destination.

title: NBC's Chuck Todd slammed for explosive claim about Biden
content: NBC's political analyst Chuck Todd has been receiving flak from Democrats after he recently said that the entire narrative on Joe Biden will change after Biden's refusal to step aside. He said he can't believe that Biden ran in 2020 after his family crisis in 2018. "You look at what has happened, I can’t believe he has put his family through this. And now, looking at his behavior now, in clinging to this, I think the entire narrative on Joe Biden is gonna change, in that everything’s always been about his ambition and his ambition comes first," Chuck Todd said.
summary: NBC's political analyst Chuck Todd has been receiving flak from Democrats after he recently said that the entire narrative on Joe Biden will change after Biden's refusal to step aside. He said he can't believe that Biden ran in 2020 after his family crisis in 2018. "You look at what has happened, I can’t believe he has put his family through this. And now, looking at his behavior now, in clinging to this, I think the entire narrative on Joe Biden is gonna change, in that everything’s always been about his ambition and his ambition comes first," Chuck Todd said.

title: 'More stressed...': European diplomat ahead of Biden's 'big boy' press meet
content: US president Joe Biden will address a press conference this afternoon -- the first since his CNN debate performance. White House has termed it the "big boy" press conference drawing much flak but now the eyes of the world leaders are on Biden as he will close out the Nato summit in Washington.
summary: US president Joe Biden will address a press conference this afternoon -- the first since his CNN debate performance. White House has termed it the "big boy" press conference drawing much flak but now the eyes of the world leaders are on Biden as he will close out the Nato summit in Washington.

title: Obama knew about George Clooney's call for Biden to drop out. He didn't object
content: After Hollywood actor and Democratic donor George Clooney called for Joe Biden's exit from the high-stake presidential race, a Politico report now claimed that former president Barack Obama was aware of Clooney's NYT essay beforehand but did not stop him. The report said Clooney had called Obama in advance to warn him that he was going to write a harsh opinion piece on the New York Times about Biden.
summary: After Hollywood actor and Democratic donor George Clooney called for Joe Biden's exit from the high-stake presidential race, a Politico report now claimed that former president Barack Obama was aware of Clooney's NYT essay beforehand but did not stop him. The report said Clooney had called Obama in advance to warn him that he was going to write a harsh opinion piece on the New York Times about Biden.

title: Newspaper Moscow Times declared 'undesirable' by Russian govt amid escalating crackdown on independent media
66 Chinese aircraft surround Taiwan in biggest sortie of year
content: Taiwan's defence ministry said Thursday it had detected 66 Chinese military aircraft around the island in a 24-hour window, a record-high this year, a day after it said Beijing was conducting exercises in nearby waters. Thursday's record comes a day after Taipei spotted Chinese aircraft around the island that it said were headed to the western Pacific for exercises with the PLA aircraft carrier Shandong.
summary: Taiwan's defence ministry said Thursday it had detected 66 Chinese military aircraft around the island in a 24-hour window, a record-high this year, a day after it said Beijing was conducting exercises in nearby waters. Thursday's record comes a day after Taipei spotted Chinese aircraft around the island that it said were headed to the western Pacific for exercises with the PLA aircraft carrier Shandong.

title: Watch: Saudi Airlines catches fire while landing in Pakistan
PM Modi lauds India-Austria friendship, shares video showcasing his recent Vienna visit
content: During PM Modi's Vienna visit, he received a guard of honour, attended community events, met leaders including Chancellor Nehammer and President Van der Bellen, and took a selfie with Nehammer. The visit marked 75 years of India-Austria relations, filled a 41-year gap, and followed a Moscow trip to meet President Putin.
summary: During PM Modi's Vienna visit, he received a guard of honour, attended community events, met leaders including Chancellor Nehammer and President Van der Bellen, and took a selfie with Nehammer. The visit marked 75 years of India-Austria relations, filled a 41-year gap, and followed a Moscow trip to meet President Putin.

title: Flyer suffers severe burns due to 'scalding hot' tea served amid turbulence, sues JetBlue
content: Tahjana Lewis is suing JetBlue for $1.5 million after suffering severe burns from a "scalding hot" tea served during turbulence on a May 15 flight. The complaint highlights gross negligence, citing the tea's dangerous temperature and inadequate assistance from the crew. Lewis experienced severe burns and emotional distress, affecting her ability to work and her daughter's well-being.
summary: Tahjana Lewis is suing JetBlue for $1.5 million after suffering severe burns from a "scalding hot" tea served during turbulence on a May 15 flight. The complaint highlights gross negligence, citing the tea's dangerous temperature and inadequate assistance from the crew. Lewis experienced severe burns and emotional distress, affecting her ability to work and her daughter's well-being.

title: NATO accuses China of 'enabling' Ukraine war; 'antiterrorist' military drills near Poland heighten concerns
content: At a Nato summit in Washington, allies pledged F-16 jets to Ukraine and potential future membership for Kyiv. China was criticized for aiding Russia, with concerns about its nuclear and space capabilities. Allies urged China to stop supporting Russia. Meanwhile, China held drills with Belarus near the Polish border, intensifying tensions.
summary: At a Nato summit in Washington, allies pledged F-16 jets to Ukraine and potential future membership for Kyiv. China was criticized for aiding Russia, with concerns about its nuclear and space capabilities. Allies urged China to stop supporting Russia. Meanwhile, China held drills with Belarus near the Polish border, intensifying tensions.

title: Biden says pressure on him is driven by elites. Voters paint a more complicated picture
Four killed as heavy rains pound South Korea
content: Heavy rains in South Korea result in four fatalities and extensive damage to infrastructure and roads. Landslide warnings issued for 50 regions with 3,500 people stranded. Interior minister notes severity as rare occurrence. Tragic deaths include individuals trapped in flooded areas and swept away by overflowing streams. Total of 44 fatalities reported from recent floods in the country.
summary: Heavy rains in South Korea result in four fatalities and extensive damage to infrastructure and roads. Landslide warnings issued for 50 regions with 3,500 people stranded. Interior minister notes severity as rare occurrence. Tragic deaths include individuals trapped in flooded areas and swept away by overflowing streams. Total of 44 fatalities reported from recent floods in the country.

title: Myanmar junta 'trying to destroy country': UN special rapporteur
content: Myanmar's junta appears to be "trying to destroy a country it cannot control", the UN special rapporteur to the country warned on Thursday. "It almost appears as if the Junta is trying to destroy a country that it cannot control."
summary: Myanmar's junta appears to be "trying to destroy a country it cannot control", the UN special rapporteur to the country warned on Thursday.  "It almost appears as if the Junta is trying to destroy a country that it cannot control."

title: 'We are in a fire year': Heat wave sparks alarming wildfire surge in western states of US
content: Western states are facing escalating wildfire dangers due to a prolonged heat wave, with temperatures soaring and humidity plummeting. California has already dealt with over 3,500 wildfires this year, burning nearly 325 square miles. Oregon also faces significant fires, while the heat wave affects over 142 million people across the US, breaking numerous heat records and causing several fatalities.
summary: Western states are facing escalating wildfire dangers due to a prolonged heat wave, with temperatures soaring and humidity plummeting. California has already dealt with over 3,500 wildfires this year, burning nearly 325 square miles. Oregon also faces significant fires, while the heat wave affects over 142 million people across the US, breaking numerous heat records and causing several fatalities.

title: New York auction to sell 150-year-old Stegosaurus skeleton: How much will it cost?
content: The largest stegosaurus skeleton, Apex, is set to be auctioned in New York, raising concerns among paleontologists about selling rare finds to private collectors. Valued at $4-6 million, it is considered highly significant but controversial in the scientific community.
summary: The largest stegosaurus skeleton, Apex, is set to be auctioned in New York, raising concerns among paleontologists about selling rare finds to private collectors. Valued at $4-6 million, it is considered highly significant but controversial in the scientific community.

title: 'The money has absolutely shut off': Joe Biden campaign faces fundraising crisis
content: The Biden campaign is struggling with fundraising following a poor debate performance against Trump. Donations have significantly declined, with large contributions potentially dropping by over half. A post-debate fundraising surge quickly dissipated, and donors were left unimpressed. Additionally, there's uncertainty about Biden's commitment to the race amid calls for his withdrawal.
summary: The Biden campaign is struggling with fundraising following a poor debate performance against Trump. Donations have significantly declined, with large contributions potentially dropping by over half. A post-debate fundraising surge quickly dissipated, and donors were left unimpressed. Additionally, there's uncertainty about Biden's commitment to the race amid calls for his withdrawal.

title: Political power couple: Clinton aide Huma Abedin gets engaged to George Soros' son Alex
Donald Trump to address Bitcoin 2024 conference on July 27
Project 2025: Inside Trump's plan to reshape America if he wins the presidency
content: Project 2025 focuses on a wide range of conservative priorities, including restricting abortion access, rolling back LGBTQ+ rights, abandoning efforts to address climate change and income inequality, and implementing sweeping changes to the federal government workforce. ​​The project calls for the dismissal of thousands of civil servants, expanding presidential power, dismantling the department of education, implementing of tax cuts, banning pornography, and halting sales of the abortion pill, among others. However, the document has faced criticism for its potential to undermine democracy and lead to political violence.
summary: Project 2025 focuses on a wide range of conservative priorities, including restricting abortion access, rolling back LGBTQ+ rights, abandoning efforts to address climate change and income inequality, and implementing sweeping changes to the federal government workforce. ​​The project calls for the dismissal of thousands of civil servants, expanding presidential power, dismantling the department of education, implementing of tax cuts, banning pornography, and halting sales of the abortion pill, among others. However, the document has faced criticism for its potential to undermine democracy and lead to political violence.
